intro: Lasiosiphon suavissimus, commonly known as the sweet-scented morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant produces fragrant, pale yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its vines can grow up to several meters in length, often climbing or trailing along supports. The seeds are enclosed in a fleshy, purple berry that ripens in the late summer or early autumn.
